intro: Lipochaeta australis var. denticulata, commonly known as the serrated lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a perennial species that produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers, often blooming in spring and summer.
